description: Lower prime of a difference of 12 between consecutive primes.
comments: Some of the terms of this sequence are primes that are separated from both their predecessor and successor primes by 12, e.g., 211, 1511, 4409, 4691, 7841, 9871, 11299, 11411, 11731.  See A053072. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 07 2013Conjecture: The sequence is infinite and for every n, a(n+1) < a(n)^(1+1/n). Namely a(n)^(1/n) is a strictly decreasing function of n (See comment lines of the sequence A248855). - _Jahangeer Kholdi_ and _Farideh Firoozbakht_, Nov 29 2014
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for primes, gaps between
example: 199 is a term as the next prime is 211.
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(4000) | NextPrime(p)-p eq 12]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 09 2013(PARI) is(n)=nextprime(n+1)==n+12 && isprime(n) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 02 2013
author: _Jeff Burch_
